article: My first performance in front of an audience was coming up soon.  I tried as hard as I could to remain _ , but I had an empty feeling in my stomach. I stared down at my sweat covered, _ hands. I looked up again at the audience, realizing that these were _ people. They were not just my mum and dad, who _ say, "Good job!" even if I messed up the entire piece. What if I had the wrong music? What if I played the wrong notes? As it turned out , I was never able to answer these questions because the spotlight was _ for me. I grasped my hands tightly together, drying off the sweat. Slowly I walked to the mulberry piano in the _ of the room. It contained 88 demanding keys, which were waiting impatiently to be played.I swallowed the golf-ball-sized lump in my throat and sat down. _ , I opened the music.Next, I rested my still shaking hands on the ivory keys. As my fingers played across the keys, I was becoming more _ of my preparation for this moment. But the memory of my year of training came flooding back. I knew that I had practiced this piece so many times that I could play it backwards if _ . Although at one point I accidentally played two keys instead of the intended one, I continued to move my fingers automatically . YCY My eyes burned holes into the page in front of me. There was no _ that I was going to lose my concentration. To keep this promise to myself, I leaned _ and focused carefully on the music.  _ I came to the end of the page, a warning _ inside my head: DON'T MAKE A MISTAKE WHEN YOU TURN THE PAGE! Needless to say, I _ myself with all my heart and mind.And, proud of my "page- turning" feat , I finished the _ of the piece without making a single mistake. After the final note died away, a celebration went into action out of my head.1 had finished.I had mastered the _ .
